org.cicirello.algengine

Class ParallelAlgorithmEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cicirello.algengine.ParallelAlgorithmEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote, RemoteParallelAlgorithms

    public final class ParallelAlgorithmEngine
extends java.lang.Object
implements RemoteParallelAlgorithms
    A Java RMI server to execute parts of parallel algorithms remotely.
    Version:
    8.15.2017
    Author:
    Vincent A. Cicirello

    • Method Detail

      • pi

        public double pi(int n,
                 int numThreads)
          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        A multithreaded Monte Carlo estimate of Pi. Divides the number of samples, n, equally among the threads. If n is not divisible by the number of threads, uses the smallest n' > n such that n' is divisible by the number of threads.
        Specified by:
        pi in interface RemoteParallelAlgorithms
        Parameters:
        n - The minimum number of samples.
        numThreads - The number of threads to use.
        Returns:
        Estimate of Pi.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - When exceptional behavior occurs on the RMI server.

      • multiply

        public final double[][] multiply(int numThreads,
                                 double[][] a,
                                 double[][] bTranspose)
                          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Matrix multiplication. Computes a*b. Assumes that the dimensions of a and b are such that a*b is a legal operation. Otherwise, may throw a bounds exception.
        Specified by:
        multiply in interface RemoteParallelAlgorithms
        Parameters:
        numThreads - The number of threads to use for the multiplication on the remote server.
        a - The first matrix,
        bTranspose - The transpose of the second matrix.
        Returns:
        a*b
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - When exceptional behavior occurs on the RMI server.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Starts up the RMI parallel algorithm server.
        Parameters:
        args - Command line arguments. Currently none.
